articles.author: Joseph Ax, Nathan Layne, Helen Coster
articles.description: Donald Trump accepted the Republican presidential nomination with a marathon speech that began with an uncharacteristic call for national unity before veering into his familiar mix of grievance, bombast and apocalyptic warnings about the country's fate if he is not returned to the White House.
articles.title: Trump clings to grievances in convention finale while Biden weighs future

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Major U.S. airlines ordered ground stops on Friday citing communications issues, while other carriers, media companies, banks and telecoms firms around the world also reported system outages were disrupting their operations.
articles.title: Global cyber outage grounds flights and disrupts businesses

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian prosecutors at the trial of U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich on Friday requested that he be jailed for 18 years on charges of spying, Russian news agencies reported.
articles.title: Russian prosecutor seeks 18-year sentence for US journalist Gershkovich

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Telecommunications were widely disrupted in Bangladesh on Friday amid violent student protests against quotas for government jobs in which nearly two dozen people have been killed this week.
articles.title: Communications widely disrupted in Bangladesh as student protests spike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump said in a post on Truth Social that he had a "very good call" on Friday with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and pledged to end the war pitting Kyiv against Moscow through negotiations.
articles.title: Trump says he had 'very good call' with Ukraine's Zelenskiy, pledges to end war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian missile hit a residential area in Ukraine's southern city of Mykolaiv on Friday, killing a child and two adults, and injuring others, the city mayor said.
articles.title: Russian missile kills three in residential area of Ukraine's Mykolaiv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A gunman on Friday shot and seriously wounded a nationalist former member of Ukraine's parliament known for vociferous campaigns to defend the Ukrainian language.
articles.title: Gunman wounds nationalist former parliamentarian in Ukraine's Lviv

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Hatem Khaled
articles.description: Israeli forces bombed parts of central Gaza on Friday, killing at least eight Palestinians in the Al-Nuseirat camp area, while fighting with Hamas militants raged in Rafah city in the south, where health officials said another five residents were killed.
articles.title: Israel bombards central Gaza, fighting rages in Rafah

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: The United Nations' highest court said that Israeli settlements in occupied Palestinian territories are illegal and all states should cooperate to bring an end to the Israel-Palestinian conflict, in an important advisory opinion issued on Friday.
articles.title: Top UN court says Israeli settlements in occupied Palestinian territory are illegal

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Harvey Weinstein could be retried on rape charges in Manhattan on Nov. 12 after a judge set a tentative trial date at a Friday court hearing.
articles.title: Harvey Weinstein retrial on NY rape charges tentatively set for Nov. 12
